etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From classical Latin piceus pitchy + -in

definitions: A glucoside present in various trees, especially willows and conifers; p -hydroxyacetophenone-β-glucoside, CH₃ ·CO·C₆ H₄ ·O·C₆ H₁₁ O₅.
(Also with capital initial.) An inert thermoplastic substance composed of hydrocarbons from rubber, shellac, and bitumen, used for making joints airtight.
